question: How do you import taxonomy data into QIIME2 using an Apptainer container?
answer: You can import taxonomy data by running `apptainer exec -B $PWD:/home -B /scratch/someuser:/outputs -B /project/def-somePI/someuser/path/to/inputs:/inputs qiime2-2021.11.sif qiime tools import --type 'FeatureData[Taxonomy]' --input-format HeaderlessTSVTaxonomyFormat --input-path /inputs/some_taxonomy_file.tax --output-path /outputs/some_output_ref-taxonomy.qza`.

question: How do you train a naive Bayes classifier in QIIME2 using an Apptainer container?
answer: To train a naive Bayes classifier, execute `apptainer exec -B $PWD:/home -B /scratch/someuser:/outputs -B /project/def-somePI/someuser/path/to/inputs:/inputs qiime2-2021.11.sif qiime feature-classifier fit-classifier-naive-bayes --i-reference-reads  /outputs/some_output_feature.qza --i-reference-taxonomy /outputs/some_output_ref-taxonomy.qza --o-classifier /outputs/some_output_classifier.qza`.

question: Why is the bind option (-B) important when running programs in an Apptainer container?
answer: It is important to use the bind option (`-B`) with each folder you want to work with when you run programs in your container to ensure data access.

question: How can a 'Timezone offset does not match system offset' error be resolved when using Apptainer with QIIME2?
answer: This error can be worked around by setting the time zone before invoking Apptainer, using `export TZ='UTC'` followed by your Apptainer command, such as `apptainer exec qiime2-2021.11.sif qiime tools import ...`.
